channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: WNBA star Brittney Griner, on trial in Russia on drug charges, made a direct plea to President Biden to work to free her https://t.co/VKdIrdNDzs

Danish police said the mass shooting at a shopping mall in Copenhagen that left three people dead on Sunday wasn’t related to terrorism. The police haven’t so far disclosed a motive for the attack. https://t.co/g0hhumg3ZE
Stressed out? Sleep deprived? Sad? You may need a good cry. These steps will help you make the most of tears. https://t.co/Ogz59InpDC
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/FnljuTlpwI
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/J6NqO07voe

President Biden said in a Fourth of July address that many Americans are worried about the divisions roiling the nation but that the country had the power to choose a “unity of purpose” https://t.co/55I6wReHEg
Update: A person of interest in a July Fourth mass shooting at a parade in a Chicago suburb was apprehended by police following a brief pursuit https://t.co/HIzflDkBNk
President Biden is expected to soften tariffs on Chinese imports soon, amid a quandary over how to ease inflation while still looking tough on Beijing https://t.co/55WtIK7JhI
The U.S. and its allies are studying the conflict with Russia over Ukraine to distill lessons. "You can’t cyber your way across a river." https://t.co/eIsE0PhVew

Women’s basketball star Brittney Griner made a direct plea to President Biden to work to free her and other Americans detained abroad, in a handwritten letter delivered to the White House https://t.co/w4iEguuAEr
A 44-acre private island in Alaska is hitting the market for $20 million https://t.co/7Rbr8EMaZg
Update: A 22-year-old man who is still at large was identified as a person of interest in a deadly shooting at a July 4 parade in a Chicago suburb, police said https://t.co/omoauhLx7v

In Moscow, bars are packed, festivals are sold out and the police are busier handing out fines for public drinking than putting down dissent. “I haven’t had this much work since before the pandemic,” a DJ says. https://t.co/zWHpOlkXKW
Inflation-protected U.S. savings bonds are yielding an eye-popping 9.62%—if you can fight through the red tape to actually buy one https://t.co/8Zx8zWwTcS
Akron declared a state of emergency and set a 9 p.m. curfew after protests over the fatal police shooting of Jayland Walker, a 25-year-old Black man https://t.co/Kj4NHQOHEz
At least five people were killed in a shooting at a Fourth of July parade in the Chicago suburb of Highland Park, Ill. The suspect remains at large. https://t.co/IgSlJB58KI
The term "bear market" has a history going back centuries, to an old proverb warning against acting prematurely: “Don’t sell the bearskin before you’ve caught the bear.” https://t.co/sVLn4lqkMc
A slide in prices for multiple raw materials, including corn, wheat and copper, is stirring hopes that a significant source of inflation might be easing https://t.co/5azlQgMkkp
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/RqyIzmgHQ9

Murder rates across the rural U.S. have soared during the pandemic, data show, bringing the kind of extreme violence long associated with major cities to America’s smallest communities. https://t.co/L7tEtJ5mVu

Misha Rohozhyn, a Ukrainian teenager with Down syndrome, fled his home in Mariupol motivated by his mother’s words—that his pro-wrestling hero John Cena lay at the end of their dangerous journey out of the war-torn nation. Then Mr. Cena showed up. https://t.co/MVQAk65srI
Air New Zealand plans to introduce pods with flat beds in economy class, initially installing them on direct flights to Chicago and New York from Auckland https://t.co/tc7cVmXETG
A 22-year-old man was taken into custody after several people were killed in a shooting at a Copenhagen shopping mall Sunday, police said https://t.co/CPEKHjM3ir

Jeff Bezos criticized President Biden for pressing gas station companies to immediately lower prices at the pump, accusing the president of “misdirection” or “a deep misunderstanding” of market forces that have driven up costs https://t.co/c4IzOva1vx
Stressed out? Sleep deprived? Sad? You may need a good cry. https://t.co/ei2YJkRkaa
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/nvdmCqJQXe
Apple released the first-ever iPhone in the U.S. on June 29, 2007. Here’s a look back at every iteration. https://t.co/Ct6BK3lNOM
Air New Zealand plans to introduce pods with flat beds in economy class, initially installing them on direct flights to Chicago and New York from Auckland https://t.co/swTqAJE8rn

Heard on the Street: The smooth acceleration shown by Tesla in the past two years faltered in the second quarter, and CEO Elon Musk has offered hints that the problems run deeper than lockdowns in Shanghai https://t.co/gjs00QM3Gg
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/tpYrmuPnkM
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/kirqTrzzvK

Jeff Bezos criticized President Biden for pressing gas station companies to immediately lower prices at the pump, accusing the president of “misdirection” or “a deep misunderstanding” of market forces that have driven up costs https://t.co/mRLrbZJN4l
It has been three weeks since crypto lender Celsius Network took the drastic step of halting customers’ withdrawals https://t.co/YzBFUXkRZW
From @WSJopinion: The Jan. 6 committee is steeped in partisanship. But Republicans can’t afford to look away from the accumulating evidence of Trump's conduct. https://t.co/Ugz68ke1ZH
With Russia able to control Ukraine’s grain exports, Moscow has found a new way to wield influence around the world https://t.co/nNmZSfLhyS

Russian forces captured Lysychansk, the last major Ukrainian stronghold in Luhansk, effectively placing under Russian control the eastern region at the epicenter of the war in recent months https://t.co/Kqad2mp7Zt
“My dogs are my life,” says footwear designer Manolo Blahnik, who has nine of them, including six puppies. https://t.co/ZuVO7QXyXL

Obituary: Leonardo Del Vecchio grew up in an Italian orphanage and went to work as a metal-molding apprentice at age 14. When he set up his own shop, he quickly realized that making eyeglass frames was the most profitable part of his business. https://t.co/pv0Ly12swE
The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the FBI’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency https://t.co/FL4nWSNeVp
Authorities in Hong Kong are searching for more than two dozen seamen in the South China Sea after a ship broke in half during a typhoon https://t.co/yKjWZ36Ddi

Russia is waging two wars right now: a hot war with Ukraine whose costs are measured in death and destruction, and a cold war with the West whose costs are measured in economic hardship and inflation. https://t.co/rs3odW6zRg

A surprising finding suggests that polar bears, which typically depend on sea ice for hunting seals, may prove resilient in the face of the continuing loss of sea ice as the climate warms https://t.co/4SD62WzKix
Companies are going all in on advertising their morning-after pills, diverting marketing budgets to spotlight legal emergency contraception https://t.co/c56jN9EhMT

Cassidy Hutchinson has faced a wave of online attacks from Trump’s supporters following her testimony before the Jan. 6 committee, and is said to have security for her own protection, people close to her said: “She is waking up to a different life." https://t.co/QDDt0GtS0M

Since Beijing imposed a national security law on Hong Kong, jailed pro-democracy leaders have spent months without trial and fear they’ll spend the rest of their lives behind bars https://t.co/mM2UjdM74M

From @WSJopinion: The fury of the left’s reaction isn’t merely about guns and abortion. It reflects their grief at having lost the Court as the vehicle for achieving policy goals they can’t get through legislatures. https://t.co/Cd5bYMbtle

From @WSJopinion: The GOP has a golden opportunity to become the party for parents, but it won’t be able to hold on to that title by simply saying so. It will need to prove it, writes @DeAngelisCorey. https://t.co/SPG3dF9EO1
The Vatican sold a London commercial building at the center of one of the biggest scandals of Pope Francis’ reign, at a loss of some $140 million https://t.co/dAjZW43vOb
From @WSJopinion: Cassidy Hutchinson showed more guts than any of Trump’s men. Her testimony strengthens the case for prosecution, writes @Peggynoonannyc. https://t.co/QLvKJlaZJj
Liz Cheney’s criticism of Donald Trump has alienated many Republicans in Wyoming, opening the door for challenger Harriet Hageman https://t.co/hAZYKUhVhu
